Get Available Data

Source: R/combine_data.R
sentimentr_data.Rd

See available sentimentr data a data.frame. Note that sentimentr_data is the main function to be used but available_data is exposed to allow other packages to use the functionality in a generic way.

Usage

available_data(regex = NULL, package = "sentimentr", ...)

sentimentr_data(regex = NULL, package = "sentimentr", ...)

Arguments

regex

A regex to search for within the data columns.

package

The name of the package to extract data from.

...

Other arguments passed to grep.

Value

Returns a data.frame

Examples

sentimentr_data()
#>                             Data
#> 1             course_evaluations
#> 2        crowdflower_deflategate

#>    1:                                                                                                             Repost from january 13, 2004 with a better fit title.
#>    2:                                                                                                      Does your apex dvd player only play dvd audio without video?
#>    3:                                                                                                 Or does it play audio and video but scrolling in black and white?
#>    4: Before you try to return the player or waste hours calling apex tech support, or run the player over with your car, try these simple troubleshooting ideas first.

#> 7090:                                                                                                                                          Appetite instantly gone.
#> 7091:                                                                                                                Overall I was not impressed and would not go back.
#> 7092:                                                                       The whole experience was underwhelming, and I think we'll just go to Ninja Sushi next time.
#> 7093:                            Then, as if I hadn't wasted enough of my life there, they poured salt in the wound by drawing out the time it took to bring the check.
#>       review_id
#>    1:         1
#>    2:         1
#>    3:         1

#> 7089:        NA
#> 7090:        NA
#> 7091:        NA
#> 7092:        NA
#> 7093:        NA

if (FALSE) {
if (!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman")
pacman::p_load(sentimentr, tidyverse, magrittr)

sentiment_data <- sentimentr_data('^hu') %>%
    pull(Data) %>%
    combine_data() %>%
    mutate(id = seq_len(n())) %>%
    as_tibble()
    
sentiment_test <- sentiment_data %>%
    select(-sentiment) %>%
    get_sentences() %$%
    sentiment(., by = c('id'))

testing <- sentiment_data %>%
    left_join(sentiment_test, by = 'id') %>%
    as_tibble() %>%
    mutate(
        actual = sign(sentiment),
        predicted = sign(ave_sentiment)
    )

testing %$%
    ftable(predicted, actual)
}
